speaker: RICHTER
line: We're not... who... we are. We're not... who we are. It goes no further than this. It stops right here... right now.

speaker: RICHTER
line: Team Captain John Richter here. It's been a couple of frustrating months but after a great deal of stick-with-it-ness, we're very proud to report that as of a half-hour ago, we surpassed the previous record for drilling down into an ice sheet.

speaker: MAN
line: All right!

speaker: MULDER
line: This team of scientists made up the Arctic Ice Core Project. They were sent to Alaska by the government's Advanced Research Project Agency nearly a year ago to drill into the arctic ice. The samples they removed contained trapped gases, dust, chemicals... evidence that could reveal the structure of the earth's climate back to the dawn of man. Their work was a success, nearly completed. No reports or indications of problems of any kind until only a week later, this next transmission was received.

speaker: RICHTER
line: We're not... who... we are. We're not... who we are. It goes no further than this. It stops... right here... right now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened up there?

speaker: MULDER
line: So far nobody's been able to reach to reach the compound because of bad weather. Obviously, they either think we're either brilliant or expendable because we've pulled the assignment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it severe isolation distress?

speaker: MULDER
line: These were top geophysicists. They were trained and screened for this project in every way imaginable, including psychological makeup. We leave for Nome today. We'll meet with three scientists familiar with the ice core project then head north up to the Icy Cape. The National Weather Service reports a three-day window to get in and out before the next arctic storm. Bring your mittens.

speaker: RADIO ANNOUNCER
line: Fouts looks over the Raiders' defense... here's the snap. Raiders blitz! Fouts dumps it across the middle to Winslow! He's at the 15! The 10! Touchdown San Diego!

speaker: MURPHY
line: Touchdown! Fouts... is... God! Sorry. My team scored.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's no football on Wednesday.

speaker: MULDER
line: Fouts retired in '87, didn't he?

speaker: MURPHY
line: No, this is just some of my all-time favorite plays on tape. You two F.B.I.?

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Mulder and Agent Scully, you?

speaker: MURPHY
line: Danny Murphy, professor of geology at U. C. San Diego.

speaker: MULDER
line: San Diego? You get much of a chance to study ice down there?

speaker: MURPHY
line: Just what's around the keg.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. DaSilva, Dr. Hodge?

speaker: HODGE
line: Yeah, sorry we're late.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi, Agent Mulder, Agent Scully...

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder, nice to meet you.

speaker: HODGE
line: How're you doing, Mister Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi.

speaker: HODGE
line: Can I see some identification?

speaker: MULDER
line: What for?

speaker: HODGE
line: I just want to make sure we are who we say we are. That's me.

speaker: MURPHY
line: That's you. It's me.

speaker: HODGE
line: It's you.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's me!

speaker: HODGE
line: Thanks a lot. Appreciate it.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's you.

speaker: HODGE
line: Well, now that we know who we are, anybody care to take a guess as to why we're going?

speaker: MURPHY
line: Well, two federal agents, a geologist, a medical doctor and a toxicologist. That should give us some idea what they're thinking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I assume you all took a look at the tape.

speaker: MULDER
line: Something wrong?

speaker: DASILVA
line: Come on, you're F.B.I. You have to know more than we do.

speaker: BEAR
line: You folks the ones going up to Icy Cape?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: BEAR
line: Then I'm the one flying you. My name's Bear. The plane's across the way, provisions are loaded. Grab your gear.

speaker: HODGE
line: Oh, could we see some credentials?

speaker: BEAR
line: Credentials. The only credentials that I have is that I'm the only pilot willing to fly you up there. You don't like those credentials... walk.

speaker: MULDER
line: Bear? See if you can get the power started.

speaker: BEAR
line: Anything to get out of here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where do we start?

speaker: HODGE
line: Body bags are on the plane.

speaker: MULDER
line: Before we touch anything, we have to thoroughly document the scene.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Flashing.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's what they were drilling for. Quarter of a million years melting away in a couple of days.

speaker: MURPHY
line: I want to preserve some samples.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's the generator.

speaker: DASILVA
line: Oh. Agent Mulder! Look out!

speaker: BEAR
line: Hold on.

speaker: HODGE
line: Hold it down!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, he didn't break the skin. Bear, you okay?

speaker: BEAR
line: He got me.

speaker: HODGE
line: Take that jacket off.

speaker: BEAR
line: Just give me the stuff, I'll do it myself.

speaker: DASILVA
line: Is it rabies?

speaker: HODGE
line: I don't see any indication of glodal spasm or tetany. If it is rabies, it's certainly not a strain I'm familiar with.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look at this. Black nodules. Swollen lymph nodes.

speaker: DASILVA
line: Symptoms of the bubonic plague.

speaker: HODGE
line: I'll do a blood test, we'll take it from that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This dog has got a skin irritation on it's neck.

speaker: MURPHY
line: It looks like it's been scratching off it's own hair.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look at this, look at this!

speaker: MURPHY
line: What the hell was that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: From the autopsies, it's clear that these men killed each other. There are contusions around the throat areas of three men, evidence of strangulation. Richter and Campbell killed themselves. I also found tissue damage due to fever.

speaker: BEAR
line: Did any of them have the black spots that the dog had?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. None of them had the black nodules.

speaker: BEAR
line: So, uh, those spots didn't have anything to do with those guys killing each other, right?

speaker: HODGE
line: I wouldn't rule it out. I just reexamined the dog. The nodules are gone.

speaker: MULDER
line: What could that mean?

speaker: HODGE
line: Well, it could mean that the spots are a symptom of some disease at an early stage.

speaker: MULDER
line: Danny? Danny.

speaker: MURPHY
line: Sorry. The play-off game against Miami, '82. Helps to get my mind off stuff.

speaker: MULDER
line: My interpretation of satellite remote sensing photos is a little rusty.

speaker: MURPHY
line: Alright, this is the Icy Cape area. It approximates the depth of the ice sheet to be about 3,000 meters thick.

speaker: MULDER
line: I also found this data and if I'm reading it correctly, the team actually found the ice sheet to be twice that depth.

speaker: MURPHY
line: That's very good. The numbers indicate the topography to be concave. Looks like they were drilling inside a meteor crater.

speaker: HODGE
line: No, you're wrong. That's impossible.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I analyzed two samples.

speaker: MULDER
line: What'd you find?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There seems to be a presence of ammonium hydroxide in Richter's blood sample.

speaker: HODGE
line: It's not possible. Ammonia would vaporize at human body temperature.

speaker: DASILVA
line: I checked all the air filtration systems. I found no evidence of any such toxins.

speaker: MURPHY
line: I have. In the ice. And that's not all there is. I found a high ratio of ammonia to water in the ice core. The earth's atmosphere could never have produced such high levels, not even a quarter of a million years ago. Look in the scope.

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless a foreign object was introduced into that environment.

speaker: MURPHY
line: Tell me that's not a foreign object.

speaker: MULDER
line: Holy... Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That same thing is in Richter's blood. What if that single-celled organism is the larval stage of a larger animal?

speaker: HODGE
line: That's kind of a leap, don't you think?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The evidence is there.

speaker: MURPHY
line: Maybe the organism in the ice core somehow got into the men.

speaker: DASILVA
line: Come on, nothing can survive in sub-zero temperatures for a quarter of a million years.

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless that's how it lives.

speaker: BEAR
line: Look-it, I don't see why you're squabbling over some bug. You said it yourself, Scully, your autopsy found those men killed each other. That's it. Now I say, let's just get the hell out of here.

speaker: HODGE
line: I agree. We can have the bodies sent to a facility where they can make a definitive diagnosis in the event that something was missed, Agent Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: If those bodies are infected with an unknown organism, we can't take them back. We can't go back without proper quarantine procedures. We can't risk bringing back the next plague.

speaker: BEAR
line: Let's say you're right, they came down with something. We haven't and I ain't waiting around until we do.

speaker: HODGE
line: I think it's safe to go back. There's no reason why we'd be infected. We've taken all the necessary biological safeguards.

speaker: DASILVA
line: The dog did bite Bear.

speaker: BEAR
line: It jumped Mulder too!

speaker: MULDER
line: It didn't break the skin -

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey, look, there's only one way to proceed. A good doctor eliminates every possibility. We must determine if any of us is infected.

speaker: HODGE
line: Alright, parasitic diagnostic procedure requires that each of us provide a blood and a stool sample.

speaker: BEAR
line: A stool sample?

speaker: MURPHY
line: Well, this kind of travel always makes that kind of tough... for me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, anyone got the morning sports section handy?

speaker: BEAR
line: I ain't dropping my cargo for no one. What I'm doing is getting my gear, getting my plane and flying the hell out of here.

speaker: MULDER
line: You can't go, the dog bit you.

speaker: BEAR
line: I got hired to fly you up here and fly you back. No one said this might be part of the deal. So the deal is over.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We can't let him leave without him being checked.

speaker: DASILVA
line: Who's going to stop him?

speaker: MULDER
line: We have to. We can't risk infecting the population.

speaker: DASILVA
line: He gets on that plane, I'm gonna be on it with him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we don't have time to argue about it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Take a vote. Whoever believes we should confine Bear until he agrees to an examination? All right. Bear, we just want to check you out. If we don't find any trace of the parasite or the virus, we'll all go.

speaker: BEAR
line: All right, give me the damn jar.

speaker: MULDER
line: Murphy, get a rope!

speaker: MURPHY
line: Right. Here!

speaker: DASILVA
line: Oh my God... oh!

speaker: HODGE
line: Get my bag!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you gonna do?

speaker: HODGE
line: Scalpel, I'm cutting it out.

speaker: MULDER
line: We don't know enough about it!

speaker: HODGE
line: It's killing him! Scully, help me hold the skin. Hold still, Bear! Forceps! Hold still, Bear, just another second. You're gonna be okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is the A.I.C.P. Investigative Team calling Doolittle Airfield, come in.

speaker: RADIO
line: D.A.F. responding.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is Agent Mulder, we have a serious biological hazard. Request air pick-up and quarantine procedures, over. Come in, Doolittle Airfield.

speaker: RADIO
line: We copy, Agent Mulder. This area is under a heavy storm and no aircraft can get out for the next day. Maybe the military base in Kotzebue can set up a quarantine. Advise immediate evacuation, the arctic storm is bearing in your direction, over.

speaker: MULDER
line: We were told we would have three clear days of weather, over.

speaker: RADIO
line: Welcome to the top of the world, Agent Mulder. Over.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is Bear in any condition to fly? We don't get out in an hour, we don't get out for days.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's dead.

speaker: HODGE
line: Well, it's similar to a tapeworm in that it has a scolex with suckers and hooks.

speaker: MURPHY
line: So then it's familiar? Something you can deal with?

speaker: DASILVA
line: What?

speaker: HODGE
line: No. Very different from any organism, at least that I know of.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you figured out how it's transmitted yet?

speaker: HODGE
line: Exchange of fluids, touch, air, all of the above? I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All of the other dead bodies had the creature. This is the only one that's still alive.

speaker: MULDER
line: Were they all in the spine?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. It appears that they were in the hypothalamus gland deep in the brain.

speaker: MURPHY
line: Hypothalamus... what was that again?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's a gland that secretes hormones although I don't know why a parasite would want to attach to it.

speaker: HODGE
line: Hypothalamus releases acetlycholine, which produces violent, aggresive behavior. That might be a connection. Everybody that's been infected certainly seems to act aggresively. Maybe the worm feeds on the acetlycholine which floods our capacity to control violent behavior.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, a parasite shouldn't want to kill it's host.

speaker: HODGE
line: It doesn't kill you until it's extracted. Then it releases a poison.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're saying it's possible that the worm makes you want to kill other people, which is maybe what happened to the first team.

speaker: DASILVA
line: Or what could happen to us.

speaker: HODGE
line: Well, it's just a theory. We don't have any definite proof.

speaker: MURPHY
line: Except five dead men.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If the worm makes people violently aggresive then why did Richter and Campbell kill themselves?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe they did it to save us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm just, uh... double-checking. Making sure I didn't miss anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just some sleep, huh?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sleep. I'm so tired I can't sleep.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're all wired and hypersensitive, it'll be good to get a fresh start in the morning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I don't want to waste a second trying to find a way to kill this thing.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know if we should kill it. This area of the ice sheet was formed over a meteor crater. The worm lived in ammonia. It survived sub-zero temperatures. Theorists in alternative life-designs believe in ammonia-supported life systems on planets with freezing temperatures.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: The meteor that crashed here a quarter of a million years ago may have carried that type of life to earth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that pilot developed surface symptoms within a few minutes. Within a few hours, that parasite had total control. What would happen if this got into the population? A city the size of New York could be infected within a few days.

speaker: MULDER
line: Exactly. But what do we know about it? This organism might be lying dormant in another crater.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, if we don't kill it now, we run the risk of becoming Richter and Campbell with guns to our heads.

speaker: MULDER
line: But if we do kill it now, we may never know how to stop it or anything like it in the future.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Future? Mulder, how can you talk about the future when right now, there's......or anyone has the right to?

speaker: MULDER
line: Do we have the right to destroy an organism which can provide...

speaker: DASILVA
line: Tell me it's hot in here.

speaker: HODGE
line: Don't worry, you don't have a fever. The heating system's malfunctioning. Outside, it's forty below and in here we're sweltering.

speaker: DASILVA
line: Can you hear what they're arguing about?

speaker: HODGE
line: They're probably discussing their little government secrets.

speaker: DASILVA
line: You think they knew it was up here before we arrived?

speaker: HODGE
line: I'm sure of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: ...about them posing a biological hazard!

speaker: HODGE
line: You know, Bear's infected blood did get on Scully.

speaker: DASILVA
line: It also got on you.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you know it can't be contained?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It can! By extermination, we should take those bodies, worms and all, outside and incinerate them!

speaker: HODGE
line: Something going on we should know about? Agent Scully, you all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I'm fine. It's nothing.

speaker: HODGE
line: You seem a little bit stressed out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What the hell are you trying to say?

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's all just settle down, it's been a long hard day. We're all tired and scared. Let's not all turn on one another.

speaker: HODGE
line: At least not without a good reason.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe we should all get some sleep.

speaker: HODGE
line: You kidding? You think any of us could sleep right now? Guys, let's face it, we've got to check for spots. Any person or persons who has them should be confined. Are we agreed on that?

speaker: DASILVA
line: Are you going to do the exams?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. We do them in front of each other. No secrets.

speaker: MULDER
line: Before anyone passes judgement, may I remind you we are in the Arctic.

speaker: HODGE
line: Sleep tight, don't let the bedbugs bite.

speaker: DASILVA
line: Yeah, good night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good night, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Good night, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: At least everyone's okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't forget, the spots on the dog went away.

speaker: RADIO ANNOUNCER
line: ...at the three yard line with fourth and goal and only fifteen seconds left in the game. Fouts goes over the ball, he snaps! He goes right... Mulder - attacked by dog Scully - exposed to infected blood Murphy - exposed to liquified ice core" He eyes the door. DaSilva rolls over in bed, almost crying. Mulder puts his gun down on the dresser and looks at the door. Later, with the lights out, Mulder wakes with a startle. He immediately checks his gun. He looks for his shoes and hears a door close. He puts on his shoes and shirt, takes his gun and flashlight and sees that Murphy's door is open. Looking in, he sees no one. The walkman is on the bed. He goes into the lab, walking around. He is startled by the dog, which growls at him. He spins around, gun aimed, until he realizes it's the dog. He goes over to the desk, then looks at the freezer. Blood drips out under the door and onto the floor. He opens the door and Murphy falls out onto him, neck slit wide open and covered with blood. Scully, DaSilva and Hodge walk in.)

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Murphy's dead.

speaker: HODGE
line: You killed him.

speaker: MULDER
line: I found him like this. I heard one of the doors close, I came out to check it out. It's one of you.

speaker: HODGE
line: He's lying.

speaker: DASILVA
line: You could have done it and not even known.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, he said he didn't do it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't have any of the symptoms.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You checked him yourself, Hodge.

speaker: HODGE
line: Yeah, six hours ago.

speaker: MULDER
line: It was one of you!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stop it! Just stop it, shut up! Mulder, just put the gun down and let Hodge give you a blood test.

speaker: MULDER
line: What, so he can doctor the results? I'm not gonna let him stick a needle in me! He could be infected!

speaker: HODGE
line: He has to be confined now!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then just turn around and let us take a look at your neck!

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not turning my back on anyone! As far as I'm concerned, you're all infected!

speaker: DASILVA
line: Hodge is right, we oughta lock him up!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, get that gun off me!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you have to understand!

speaker: MULDER
line: Put it down!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You put it down first!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully! For God sakes, it's me!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... you may not be who you are.

speaker: MULDER
line: In here, I'll be safer than you.

speaker: HODGE
line: What were you doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know what I was doing.

speaker: HODGE
line: You know, I can't help thinking, Agent Scully, that you're the only one with a gun. If you get infected, we don't stand a chance, do we?

speaker: DASILVA
line: Was there something there?

speaker: HODGE
line: You're okay, Nancy. We're all okay. Now is not the time for the three of us to break down and turn on each other.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's four of us.

speaker: HODGE
line: Mulder isn't one of us anymore.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If Mulder is infected, it's not his fault! We can't turn our backs on him now, he needs us to help him!

speaker: DASILVA
line: She's right. Who knows what prolonged exposure to the parasite could do to him? It could damage him to the point of permanent psychosis.

speaker: HODGE
line: But if he is infected, he doesn't go back! I won't risk the possibilities!

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is A.I.C.P. calling Doolittle Airfield, please come in. This is the Arctic Ice Core Project sending a general distress call, please respond!

speaker: HODGE
line: Nanc, you wanna put a drop of the uninfected blood on the slide of the blood drawn from the pilot?

speaker: DASILVA
line: Run that by me again.

speaker: HODGE
line: Put the uninfected blood on the infected blood. No, damn it! What did I just get through telling you? You just infected already infected blood, now we have to start all over again.

speaker: DASILVA
line: I made a mistake, you don't have to yell at me.

speaker: HODGE
line: Wasted hours of work...

speaker: DASILVA
line: Well okay, well then maybe you could just do it by yourself! Damn it! God, I'm not your assistant!

speaker: HODGE
line: Oh, get out of here...

speaker: DASILVA
line: All you do is just...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hodge.

speaker: HODGE
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Come take a look at this. The larvae from two different worms killed each other. An individual worm will not tolerate another invading it's host. It does to the invader what it did to humans. It makes them kill.

speaker: HODGE
line: It doesn't make sense for a species to kill it's own, it needs another to procreate.

speaker: DASILVA
line: Worms are hermaphroditic. It can reproduce itself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look at the evidence in the microscope. This thing does not like company.

speaker: HODGE
line: So what are you saying? The way to kill it is to introduce another worm into the already infected body? Sounds okay. It passed the worms in it's stool. They're dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want to talk to him first. Try to make this voluntary.

speaker: DASILVA
line: What?

speaker: HODGE
line: You can't go in alone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If anything happens, you come inside. I can't do this to him until I'm sure.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's just you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's one of them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No one's been killed since you've been in here.

speaker: MULDER
line: So?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We found a way to kill it. Two worms in one host will kill each other.

speaker: MULDER
line: You give me one worm, you'll infect me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If that's true, then why didn't you let us inspect you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I would have but you pulled a gun on me. Now I don't trust them. I wanted to trust you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. But now they're not here.

speaker: DASILVA
line: This is the last one. She's not going to let us give it to him.

speaker: HODGE
line: Well, she'll have to if he's infected.

speaker: DASILVA
line: He'll convince her somehow.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just examined him. He's... uninfected.

speaker: MULDER
line: So is she.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which means that it must be one of you.

speaker: HODGE
line: All right. Go over to the main building. I'd like to check him myself. Then he can examine both of us. Wanna lead the way? Get the worm!

speaker: MULDER
line: Bastards! No! Ah! Stop... no!

speaker: HODGE
line: Oh my God! Mulder! It's her!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully! It's DaSilva!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hodge! Now! Mulder! After this, there won't be any left!

speaker: MULDER
line: Do it!

speaker: DASILVA
line: Nooooo! No! No!

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's all right. It's all over. It all stops right here. Right now.

speaker: HODGE
line: She's being put in quarantine along with the dog. We'll keep her there until we're sure she won't infect the rest of the population. Meanwhile, our tests came back normal so we've been released. Plane ready. Take you as far from the ice as you want to go.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going back to the site. This time, I'm going fully prepared with proper equipment. There's still a lot of research to be done on it's genetic structure, on it's origin...

speaker: HODGE
line: Wait, Mulder. Don't you know?

speaker: MULDER
line: Know what?

speaker: HODGE
line: 45 minutes after they evacuated us, they torched the place. There's nothing left.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who did that?

speaker: HODGE
line: The military, centers for disease control... you oughta know. They're your people.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's still there, Scully. 200,000 years down in the ice.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Leave it there.
